titles.title: Shimoneta to Iu Gainen ga Sonzai Shinai Taikutsu na Sekai
A Boring World Where the Concept of Dirty Jokes Doesn`t Exist
Скучный мир, в котором не существует самой концепции похабных шуток
不存在黄段子的无聊世界
不存在下流梗的无聊世界
下流梗不存在的灰暗世界
shimoseka
下ネタという概念が存在しない退屈な世界
Shimoneta: A Boring World Where the Concept of Dirty Jokes Doesn`t Exist
Shimoseka
没有黄段子存在的无聊世界

recommendations.recommendation: The best of Summer 2015 season. Some great characters and comedy in this. Also while the premise is ridiculous, it manages to hit some serious points pretty hard. Must watch if you don`t take yourself too seriously.

Easily the best series aired during Summer 2015. I found it light-hearted and highly enjoyable. Shimoneta might not be a must-see, but it is definitely a solid series, especially if you enjoy its lewd humour. It kept me good company during a rough year, and I hope there will be a next installment to enjoy! Recommended!

anime.description: 16 years after the Law for Public Order and Morals in Healthy Child-Raising banned coarse language in the country, http://anidb.net/ch73300 [Okuma Tanukichi] enrolls in the country`s leading elite public morals school and is soon invited into the Anti-Societal Organization (SOX) by its founder, http://anidb.net/ch73302 [Kajou Ayame]. As a member blackmailed into joining by Ayame, Tanukichi ends up taking part in obscene acts of terrorism against the talented student council president http://anidb.net/ch73298 [Anna Nishikinomiya], whom Tanukichi has a crush on. Source: ANN Note: The first episode received an early screening at Yebisu Garden Room on 28.06.2015. The regular TV broadcast started on 04.07.2015.

externalentity.identifier: 下ネタという概念が存在しない退屈な世界

tag.name: trap
tag.description: A male character often mistaken as a female by other characters and/or the viewer due to his feminine appearance, behaviour, and/or language (regardless of his intention). The reverse case is known as a http://anidb.net/t1637 [reverse trap].

tag.name: cross-dressing
tag.description: This character sometimes wears clothes traditionally worn by and associated with the opposite sex. Cross-dressers often hide their cross-dressing identity for a long period of time and thus tend to become adept in accurately portraying the opposite sex in terms of voice, movement, behaviour, temperament, etc.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: satire
tag.description: In satire, vices, follies, abuses, and shortcomings are held up to ridicule, ideally with the intent of shaming individuals, and society itself, into improvement. Although satire is usually meant to be funny, its greater purpose is often constructive social criticism, using wit as a weapon. (Wikipedia)

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Last stronghold for humanity. If Tokyo falls, it`s all over. Tokyo Tower will undoubtedly fall anyway.

tag.name: nudity
tag.description: Nudity is the state of wearing no clothing. The wearing of clothing is exclusively a human characteristic. The amount of clothing worn depends on functional considerations (such as a need for warmth or protection from the elements) and social considerations. In some situations the minimum amount of clothing (i.e. covering of a person`s genitals) may be socially acceptable, while in others much more clothing is expected. People, as individuals and in groups, have varying attitudes towards their own nudity. Some people are relaxed about appearing less than fully clothed in front of others, while others are uncomfortable or inhibited in that regard. People are nude in a variety of situations, and whether they are prepared to disrobe in front of others depends on the social context in which the issue arises. For example, people need to bathe without clothing, some people also sleep in the nude, some prefer to sunbathe in the nude or at least topless, while others are nude in other situations. Some people adopt naturism as a lifestyle. Though the wearing of clothes is the social norm in most cultures, some cultures, groups and individuals are more relaxed about nudity, though attitudes often depend on context. On the other hand, some people feel uncomfortable in the presence of any nudity, and the presence of a nude person in a public place can give rise to controversy, irrespective of the attitude of the person who is nude. Besides meeting social disapproval, in some places public nudity may constitute a crime of indecent exposure. Many people have strong views on nudity, which to them can involve issues and standards of modesty, decency and morality. Some people have an psychological aversion to nudity, called gymnophobia. Many people regard nudity to be inherently sexual and erotic. Nudity is to be found in a multitude of media, including art, photography, film and on the Internet. It is a factor in adult entertainment of various types. Especially gratuitous fanservice anime shows tend to show their (usually female) characters frequently without any clothes, though often hiding genitals through the means of additions like steam. Source: wiki

tag.name: novel
tag.description: Note that novel means book with words in paper, so no comics and no "visual novels", which should go under manga and dating-sim - visual Novel/erotic game respectively. Note that it can be applied to novels as we know them but also the typical light novels for teens and young adults, which are common in Japan and aside from being short include a number of illustrations.

tag.name: pantsu
tag.description: "Panties" in Japanese. Upskirt views in various positions are typical, however all forms of partial or fully exposed panties are accepted. Exposure is usually accidental, but may also be deliberate. Pantsu views may be exclusive to the viewer without impacting any characters. Bikinis are not pantsu.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: ecchi
tag.description: Fan service is found in many anime, in many forms. When the service has a distinctly sexual slant to it, and it appears to be a major focus of the show, then it`s safe to assume you`re watching ecchi. The word "ecchi" is used by English-speaking anime fans to refer to refer to soft-core pornographic or sexually suggestive anime and manga. This is a western invention; in Japanese, it is a catch-all term for all things anyhow sexual in nature, not being limited to porn, but also not really considered a "milder" term, as it may also refer to sexual intercourse itself. The term "ecchi" in Japanese comes from the pronunciation of the letter "H" in English, which is rendered into Japanese syllabary as エッチ, which in turn is transliterated in the English alphabet as "ecchi" or "etchi". It is not, as many believe, short for "hentai" -- that, too, seems to be a western invention. It is, however, nearly as misunderstood and misapplied a term as "hentai". The line between ecchi and hentai, from the western perspective over these terms, can be hard to draw at times; one good rule of thumb is: if it was aired on Japanese public TV at all, it probably wasn`t hentai. Ecchi usually features all the specifics to human anatomy that can only be found in anime, and generally avoids full nudity, instead abusing of panty shots. Hentai, on the other hand, will usually show full frontal nudity in some explicit form, including genitalia, and full, intimate sex scenes. At its mildest, ecchi is composed of double entendres, big misunderstandings, and sexual farce; at its most explicit, it is still in the realm of softcore pornography, with full breast shots, full back nudity and similar content, but no display of genitalia. Another good way to distinguish the two is looking for animated sex scenes; if one is found, you have generally left the genre entirely, though a few borderline exceptions apply here. For AniDB`s purposes, the distinction between explicit ecchi and actual hentai is simple: if it was sold with a 18+ restriction in its country of origin, it is hentai; if it was sold without it, it is ecchi. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: politics
tag.description: From commies to fat capitalist pigs, all the stuff done by the "guys with the power", mainly evil tactics for gaining more power over the masses. Watching this title may remind you why CNN is boring.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: crime
tag.description: The underworld we talk about here is not to be confused with the place where people are believed to go after they die, but the general term for organized crime. It is a shady world, unknown to most people, where illegal things like murder, smuggling, drug dealing and similar are happening daily. Groups known to be acting in this world are for example the mafia or the yakuza.

tag.name: dystopia
tag.description: A dystopia (from Ancient Greek: δυσ-, "bad, ill", and Ancient Greek: τόπος, "place, landscape"; alternatively cacotopia, or anti-utopia) is, in literature, an often futuristic society that has degraded into a repressive and controlled state, often under the guise of being utopian. Dystopian literature has underlying cautionary tones, warning society that if we continue to live how we do, this will be the consequence. A dystopia, thus, is regarded as a sort of negative utopia and is often characterized by an authoritarian or totalitarian form of government. Dystopias usually feature different kinds of repressive social control systems, a lack or total absence of individual freedoms and expressions and constant states of warfare or violence. Dystopias often explore the concept of humans abusing technology and how humans individually and collectively cope with technology that has evolved too quickly such as the car, the flamethrower or the microwave. A dystopian society is also often characterized by widespread poverty and brutal political controls such as a large military-like police.

tag.name: parental abandonment
tag.description: In Japan it is a common custom for parents to leave their children alone at home and embark on a lifelong trip around the world once they hit the tender age of 14, sometimes even earlier. Of course this is done because the parents believe their children are independent enough to get their act together. But little do they know about the small secrets their offspring has, such as a childhood fiancé(e) or even a forbidden incestuous love between their (often not-blood-related) children. Of course aside from having a huge house, financial support is provided as well. Usually through the means of MAGICAL MONEY. In rare cases the parents actually die (shortly) before embarking on their world-trip, which is self-evidently used as an important plot device in the development of the child.

tag.name: rotten world
tag.description: A rotten world is a setting or situation where the jaded notion that "anything that can go wrong will go horribly wrong" almost always applies. Oppression, perpetual warfare, lawlessness, despair or other forms of mental instability, and other highly undesirable factors tend to be rampant.

tag.name: wordplay
tag.description: The characters play with words. E.g. purposely or accidentally use similar-sounding but wrongly applied words in the Japanese original, leading to supposedly funny misunderstandings and confusion.

tag.name: TV censoring
tag.description: The TV version is censored and later DVD/BD releases are uncensored, so the money-grubbing capitalists can make a couple more bucks at our expense.

tag.name: governmental censorship
tag.description: Censorship is the suppression of speech or deletion of communicative material which may be considered objectionable, harmful or sensitive, as determined by a censor. In fiction (particularly dystopian sci-fi works) often used by totalitarian regimes to control the people.

tag.name: penis jokes
tag.description: A penis or other phallic object is used as a device to elicit laughter from the viewer. This also includes indirect references to such objects provided the intent is clearly the same.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: terrorism
tag.description: Common definitions of terrorism refer only to those violent acts that are intended to create fear (terror); are perpetrated for a religious, political, or ideological goal; and deliberately target or disregard the safety of non-combatants (e.g., neutral military personnel or civilians). Some definitions now include acts of unlawful violence and war. The use of similar tactics by criminal organizations for protection rackets or to enforce a code of silence is usually not labeled terrorism, though these same actions may be labeled terrorism when done by a politically motivated group. Usage of the term has also been criticized for its frequent undue equating with Islamism or jihadism, while ignoring non-Islamic organizations or individuals Source: wiki

episode.title: 公序良俗は誰が為に
Whom Does Public Order and Morality Serve?
À qui servent les bonnes mœurs et l`ordre moral ?
Koujoryouzoku wa Tagatameni
episode.summary: Tanikuchi Okuma enrols in the country`s leading elite public morals school from a much lower-ranked one, out of admiration for the student council president Anna Nishikinomiya. It is the morning of the first day of school, and on the train there, he notices a male student looking at him intently, who is later accused by a woman of molesting her. He knows that this isn`t true (the woman is just trying to extort the guy) so he makes a distraction, making people think that he was the molester. As he tries to get away he is surrounded by security, but the notorious terrorist Blue Tundra suddenly appears and makes an even bigger distraction that allows him to escape. When Okuma arrives in school it is obvious that there are many students who are badly repressed, such as Fuwa Hyouka, who is obsessed about how babies are really made. He is summoned to the student council and called upon to help assist investigation of the incidents of terrorist indecency that have been occurring lately. Anna directs another member of the student council, Kajou Ayame, to show him the ropes. It turns out that Ayame is none other than Blue Tundra, and she blackmails Okuma into assisting with her terrorist plots. Blue Tundra`s next operation occurs during a student assembly, where she drops sexy pictures and shows a film of copulating flies to her making lewd noises, which has a terrible effect on the badly repressed students.

episode.title: 世界いわく, 愛は正義
The Saying Goes... Love Is Justice.
L`amour est toujours juste
Sekai Iwaku, Ai wa Seigi
episode.summary: Tanikuchi is in the hospital after being injured by the stalkers, and is concerned that Anna has never visited him even once since the incident. After his release, he learns that Anna has made the school crackdowns on indecency even more severe, and that he appears to have suddenly become the target of another stalker himself. Ayame continues her terrorist plots and learns of a stash of true hardcore pornography that somehow escaped the purges, and she plots to have the students discover it but Sophia Nishikinomiya has arranged an event promulgating even harsher measures on the same day. Ayame has also convinced Otome to join their cause as an erotic artist, but she has an artistic block and needs to see such indecency live in order to draw it. To get the latter to happen she has Tanikuchi invite his stalker in while Otome watches in an adjoining room. The stalker turns out to be none other than Anna, who, being excessively repressed and ignorant of the nature of her sexual urges strips naked and tears off his clothes, and very nearly has intercourse with him right there and then, but Ayame suddenly arrives and she runs off.

episode.title: 人の愛し方
How to Love Someone
Comment aimer son prochain
Hito no Aishi Kata
episode.summary: Anna has been receiving letters from a stalker, but she keeps this secret from the rest of the council, although everyone can tell that she is troubled by something. Saotome, the much-admired artist of the school, tears up an award she has been given. She blackmails Tanikuchi into cooperating with her plans to get closer to someone she loves, as she saw him remove his disguise after the last terrorist incident. She confesses that she loves Anna as well, forcing Tanikuchi to tell her that he loves Ayame instead. Ayame comes up with a plan to catch Anna`s stalker, by posing as her boyfriend and provoking the stalker into revealing himself, with Gouriki watching ready to apprehend the stalkers should they arrive. Both Tanikuchi and Saotome are also watching on the sidelines. The plan works, and the stalker reveals himself, and Ayame manages to subdue him, but there are two more stalkers present. Tanikuchi manages to subdue one them but is struck in the process, and as he falls he lands on top of Anna and winds up kissing her. He is badly injured, but Anna is deeply affected by the kiss.

episode.title: 妊娠のなぞ
The Mysteries of Pregnancy
Le secret de la conception
Ninshin no Nazo
episode.summary: Ayame once again gets Tanikuchi to assist her in her terrorist plots, first finding a cache of pornographic magazines, surreptitiously duplicating them and hiding them in various places around the school for students to find. The student council secretary Gouriki distrusts him (despite being the one he saved from accusations of molestation at the train), and he tells them that his father was, like Ayame`s, an activist against the new laws that created the censorship state, and was arrested and imprisoned as a result. He was ostracised for much of his childhood and only Anna, whom he met in kindergarten, showed him any kindness, so ever since he distanced himself from his father`s ideology. This convinces the council of his sincerity. There is an upcoming health examination at the school, and Anna`s mother has a new bill in the wings that will tighten social control still more. Ayame performs another terrorist plot that involves conducting an "eye exam" that will make the students read individual letters and explain the actual process of making babies using what is considered obscene language, without tripping off their collars. He is chased by Anna and Gouriki and very narrowly escapes capture, but from a distance a student sees him remove his disguise.

episode.title: 下ネタという概念が存在しない退屈な世界 放送直前SP!
Episode S1
Shimoneta to Iu Gainen ga Sonzai Shinai Taikutsu na Sekai: Housou Chokuzen SP!
悪魔が来たりてホラを吹く
The Devil Blows His Own Trumpet
Le diable vient et joue du pipeau
Akuma ga Kitarite Hora o Fuku
episode.summary: Kosuri is staying in Tanukichi`s apartment for the time being, and Anna, unstable as always, breaks in and finds them sleeping together. He introduces Kosuri as his little sister, which mollifies Anna somewhat but she still stabs the floor around Kosuri, making her fall into unit below. The Public Morals Committee has also assigned a trained disciplinary officer to the school named Tsukimigusa Oboro, who sees indecency everywhere, but actually proves remarkably easy to manipulate. Later, SOX has a meeting, and Ayame explains that their next mission is to infiltrate the nearby Zoushigaoka Academy and try to at least get some of their dirty pictures in. Kosuri says she will take care of it and three days later she has outdone herself, having produced accurate information on the school that will allow them to distribute their pornographic pamphlets without detection. Kosuri begins to boss it over on Tanukichi, and she explains how she managed to infiltrate the school by deviously manipulating the student council members` feelings, and he objects, saying that Ayame would never approve of such methods that involved hurting people. She says that he would not expose her actions to the woman he loves, as it was evident to her that he is in love with Ayame.

episode.title: SOXが作りし者
What SOX Created
L’Œuvre du SOX
SOX ga Tsukurishi Mono
episode.summary: There has been a recent rash of underwear theft incidents in the school and Anna has ordered an investigation. These incidents are being blamed on SOX causing the group`s reputation to fall among the students, so Tanukichi and Ayame investigate the matter seriously. They stake out the girls` changing rooms in an attempt to catch the thief, and when Ayame comes closer to investigate, Anna molests Tanukichi again until Gouriki comes by. After recovering Tanukichi comes to check on Ayame and finds she is confronting Hyouka, who is hiding a yaoi manga by Otome starring characters clearly based on himself and Gouriki, which he confiscates and destroys. Meanwhile, Anna and Gouriki have managed to capture a large group of the underwear thieves, who are identified by a projection of their leader as members of a group called Moist Throng, saying that they are inspired by SOX. Ayame is incensed as this Moist Throng seems to have a far more radical agenda than SOX, and the reputation of their group is suffering by association, so they resolve to stop them somehow. After the meeting Tanukichi runs into a young girl named Onigashira Kosuri who is on the run from the moral police, and he helps her escape, and tells him that she is the daughter of Onigashira Keisuke, the secret financial backer of many naughty terror groups, and that she is trying to join SOX. Ayame, though sceptical and suspicious of her reluctantly allows her to join the group.

episode.title: 手作りのぬくもり!
Handmade Warmth!
Accessoires artisanaux !
Tezukuri no Nukumori!
episode.summary: SOX is scheming to rebuild various types of sex toys that have long been banned, based on descriptions in the stash of pornography they recovered, as well as others from oral tradition. They have Hyouka make a few remote control vibrators, and as Tanukuchi is getting ready to take them, Anna barges in, so he has to make excuses to her for why he is meeting with Hyouka. He says he was asking advice for a gift he was planning to give Anna, which she takes to be the vibrator, and he makes her think is a sort of a charm stone. She is happy to take it and later turns it into a pendant. The next day, Anna calls them to the student council for a meeting, when the pendant/vibrator turns on unexpectedly. This drives her into a frenzy, and the remote control doesn`t seem to work, so he tries to escape and ask Hyouka to help fix it, which she cannot without the actual unit. Anna catches up to him, and he is driven into a corner and she embraces his lower half, the vibrator stimulating him nearly to the point of climax, but it breaks down just in the nick of time.

episode.title: 下ネタテロは誰が為に
Dirty Terrorism Benefits Whom?
À qui sert l’éro-terrorisme
Shimoneta Tero wa Tagatameni
episode.summary: Tanukuchi is jarred by Anna`s behaviour, and cannot accept that the pure, sweet girl he admired has an irrational, perverted side. She constantly stalks him, preventing him from distributing the pamphlets with Otome`s indecent drawings and the instructions on where to find the stash of pornography, and even threatens Ayame with scissors as it seems she is too close to him. He drops the batch of pamphlets in Hyouka`s lab after Anna confronts him one more time. Thus thwarted, Ayame and Tanukuchi try to recover the porn themselves, although this is clearly impossible for them to do alone, as there are many guards at the grove where it is hidden. However, Hyouka distributed the pamphlets herself and arrives with a large number of students, who serve to distract the guards as Ayame and Tanukuchi enter and don their SOX disguises. Anna is there however, and she fights Ayame, while Tanukuchi recovers some of the pornography and a BDSM costume that he incorporates into his SOX disguise. Though he is conflicted, he helps Ayame fight Anna, who falls down a hill into the grove. The students who participated are arrested and forced to sign their support for the more repressive law Sophia is sponsoring. SOX however, managed to steal the students` signatures and replaced them with dirty pictures, so Sophia finds herself in trouble for public display of indecency and her efforts at passing the law are thwarted for the time being.

episode.title: 下ネタよ永遠に
Dirty Jokes Forever
Obscénité for ever
Shimoneta yo Eien ni
episode.summary: The members of SOX receive an invitation to the Nukumi Resort allegedly from Sophia Nishikinomiya. Tanukichi remembers how his father had given him a valve handle for use if he should ever go to Nukumi. This makes them decide to go there despite their misgivings. At the resort they see Gouriki and Anna, who have received similar invitations. They go to the baths, where Anna has entered the men`s side in an attempt to seduce Tanukichi, but as she does this, they hear Sophia just outside being attacked by someone. They see her at the entrance to the baths, unconscious, and dressed in black underwear. She too received an invitation to go to Nikumi, allegedly from Anna, which she claims she never sent. They meet the one who sent the invitations, a man covered in black panties. He has taken all of their clothes and left them black underwear to wear instead. The man in black explains how the valve handle Tanukichi has is the key to a great treasure, They manage to escape, recovering the valve handle, and explore the ruined buildings to find a place where it will fit. They find a valve stem that fits it exactly, and turning it, they find a treasure trove of erotic art that had been hidden from the censorship state. They seal it back up again, hoping that it can be opened in the future when the country is ready for it.

episode.title: テクノブレイク
Techno Break
Techno Break
Techno Break
episode.summary: Kosuri also gets Tanukichi to leave the bus, and she and White Peak bring their bus to Zoshigaoka Academy, where White Peak, in his guise as the student Ichinose Takuma, studies. Moist Throng has taken about 500 hostages and the PMC has besieged the campus. They have demanded food and drink for the hostages as well as a mass of new panties, threatening to publish compromising pictures of the hostages otherwise. Kosuri soon realises that she made a mistake betraying SOX for them, as she learns that Takuma and Moist Throng are not the revolutionaries looking to change the country she thought them to be, but just common perverts out to sate their lusts until the PMC decides to break through. She is bound and gagged as a hostage after she unsuccessfully attacks him. Meanwhile Tanukichi and Ayame get in contact with each other and formulate a new plan. They receive a call from Saotome who is among the hostages, and she provides intelligence on the conditions inside the school. Although Tanukichi has his reservations about this plan which goes against his ethics, he disguises his scent by constantly washing himself and goes to Anna, convincing her to temporarily ally with SOX to defeat Moist Throng and retrieve his underwear which they have stolen. Anna, Gouriki, and Oboro join Ayame and Tanukichi and together they manage to defeat Moist Throng.

episode.title: ジイ級クエスト
Masturbation Quest
Branlette Quest
G Kyuu Quest
episode.summary: The meeting between SOX and Moist Throng`s leader goes badly as the two groups are unable to settle their differences, and the leader leaves, hinting that they are planning something big. The next day, the monorail system has broken down and Tanukichi has to rush to get to the bus. Gouriki is on the same bus and he tells him that power to the monorail was sabotaged. Ayame calls him, warning him that he must not use the buses, but one of the Moist Throng terrorists has revealed himself, hijacking the bus and threatening all the passengers with a gun. 42 such buses were hijacked. Hyouka realises that the terrorist on her bus has a fake gun, and that permits the other passengers to subdue the terrorist. Anna goes berserk and beats up the terrorist on her bus. The terrorist on the bus with Gouriki and Tanukichi is disgusted on seeing Gouriki wearing only his underwear that he is likewise subdued. Told that there is actually one gun among the 39 remaining buses that is real, the authorities are forced to tread carefully. Tanukichi meets up with Ayame and they come up with a plan to apprehend Moist Throng and its leader White Peak themselves, thereby dissociating them from SOX. They use Kosuri`s panties as bait to lure the bus with White Peak away, and moving quickly, Tanukichi boards the bus and fights White Peak but winds up getting beaten up. Ayame arrives in her Blue Tundra disguise and the two of them manage to subdue White Peak, but Kosuri betrays them and knocks Ayame out of the bus, while the PMC chases her away. Kosuri declares herself for Moist Throng.

episode.title: アンドロイドは電気アンマの夢を見るか
Do Androids Dream of Electric Masseurs?
Les androïdes rêvent-ils de casse-noisettes électriques ?
Android wa Denki Anma no Yume o Miruka
episode.summary: Ayame hatches a plan to disassociate Moist Throng and SOX. Reasoning that they seek out the underwear they steal by smell, they use Tanukichi`s underwear as bait. Ayame goes out as Blue Tundra to distract the PMC and the Student Council, while Tanukichi sets the trap, while Kosuri and Otome secretly go around hiding more dirty pictures around campus. The plan does not quite work when Anna is drawn by the scent of Tanukichi`s underwear instead, believing it to be her reward, and is crestfallen when he tells her that it was a trap for Moist Throng. Actual members of Moist Throng steal the underwear from Anna, who chases after them. Although the plan did not quite work, Ayame says that a lot of good came out of it: it showed that they can use Tanukichi`s underwear to distract Anna and get the student council off their tails. They repeat the plan the next day with this in mind, using Otome`s underwear as the real bait for Moist Throng instead. The plan goes remarkably well, as Tanukichi manages to subdue many Moist Throng members, until at the girls` changing room while tying up one of them, the power is cut as the fire alarm sounds. He encounters Oboro, and exposes him as a man. Anna comes in soon after to change her clothes made wet by the sprinklers, and Tanukichi makes his escape by tossing her his underwear. It turns out that Kosuri had spoken to Fuwa and asked her to bring the Moist Throng students to the changing rooms where Tanukichi had been waiting, and she had also activated the fire alarm as a distraction. This concerns Ayame because it complicated the plan, establishing a link between SOX and the regular student body through Fuwa, and the fire alarm caused the incident with Oboro and Anna. Later, they receive a note from the leader of Moist Throng and have a confrontation with him at the park.
